etymologies: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to German dialect Ilm, and Swedish and Norwegian alm

definitions: a tall deciduous tree that typically has rough serrated leaves and propagates from root suckers.

notes.text: Genus Ulmus, family Ulmaceae: several species, including the English elm (U. procera) and the American elm (U. americana), now largely lost to Dutch Elm disease

shortDefinitions: tall deciduous tree that has rough serrated leaves
